page.title: 16SHOPPING PATTERNS
page.content: Fletching High Street once boasted 12 shops - 2 remain. The coming of the motor car, fridge and freezer means that many famiilies now drive to supermarkets in Uckfield,Haywards Heath or Lewes, stock up fridge and freezer for the week. Small country food shops struggle to compete with the supermarkets low prices and quick turnover. Those without cars can go by bus either to Uckfield or Haywards Heath. The bus service has been cut back savagely but there is still one bus in the morning to Haywards Heath and one to Uckfield both doing return trips in the evening. The vicar runs a minibus once a mouth to take pensioners shopping in Eastbourne. The two shops remaining are a post office/general store and a butcher. {D Skan
